question: Question_05
statement:
True or false (explain your answer): If A is a square matrix, then
$\displaystyle \text{det}(-A) = - \text{det}(A)$.
sols:
The answer is \textbf{false}.

Let \emph{A} be the 2 by 2 identity matrix. Then

$\text{det}(-A) = \text{det}(-I) = \text{det}\left(\begin{bmatrix} -1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix}\right) = (-1)(-1)-(0)(0) = 1$where as

$\text{det}(A) = \text{det}(I) = \text{det}\left(\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix}\right) = (1)(1)-(0)(0) = 1 \neq -\det(-A)$.
